2/4/2019 Notes¶

We have a quiz that we need to do online.

Need to read the reading for today.

Flood Probability¶

Define our random variable

\(X_i\)

Which is the largst peak discharge in year i.

Events (flood)

\(\{X_i \geq x_p\}\) is a flood event

\(P\{X_i \geq x_p\} = p\) execedance probability

Probability Theory¶

Random Variables

\(P\{flood\} + P\{NoFlood\} = 1\) is the total probability.

\(P\{NoFlood\} = 1 - P\{flood\}\)

\(P\{X_i < x_p\} = 1 - p\) Non-excedance probability

Independence

\(P\{No Flood in 2 years\} = P\{No Flood, Yr 1\} * P\{No Flood, Yr 2\}\)

\(P\{No Flood in 2 years\} = (1-p)(1-p)\)

\(P\{No Flood in M Years\} = (1-p)(1-p)...(1-p) = (1-p)^M\)

Risk

\(R = P\{At Least 1 event in M years\}\) \(R = 1 - P\{No Floods in M years\}\) \(R = 1 - (1 - p)^M\)

Return Period¶

Drawing a timeline with a flood threshold dotted line

Charting over time the occurence of a flood event

The time between each occurence is called the RECURRENCE INTERVAL

Define: T, return period, average recurrence interval of a given event.

\(T = \frac{1}{p}\)

Frequency Analysis¶

Estimate probabilities from sample data.

Typical Frequency Analysis problems

If \(x_p\) is known –> what is the probability, \(P\) that it is exceeded? Estimate \(p(\hat{p})\) or \(T(\hat{T})\)

Hats mean estimates

If \(p\) or \(T\) known –> estimate \(x_p(\hat{x_p})\) or \(x_t(\hat{x_T})\)

US Federal Method - Bulletin 17C¶

Log Pearson Type III Distribution

  • Take the logarithms of sample data

    \(y_i = log(Q_i)\) where \(i = 1,..,N\)

  • Estimate Moments

    \(\mu_y,\sigma_y,\gamma_y\) which are estimated from \(\hat{\mu_y}, \hat{\sigma_y}, \hat{\gamma_y}\)

    These are mean, standard deviation, skew coefficient

  • Find a weighted skew coefficient \(\hat{\gamma_w}\)

    \(\hat{\gamma_R}, \hat{MSE_{\gamma_R}}\)

  • Quantile Estimate

    \(log{\hat{Q_T}} = \hat{\mu_y} + K(T,\hat{\gamma_w}) * \hat{\sigma_y}\)

There's a discussion on the regional skew estimate. Iowa's study resulted in a regional skew of -0.40
